    • CHAR_UNDEFINED

      public static char CHAR_UNDEFINED

  • Konstruktordetails

      public Draw()

  • Methodendetails

    • setFpsColor

      public static void setFpsColor(int r, int g, int b)

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the screen with the background color. This color can be set using setBackgroundColor.

    • syncToFrameRate

      public static void syncToFrameRate()
      Suspends the program until a new frame can be displayed and swaps the front and back buffers to avoid artifacts. A call to clearScreen can be performed safely afterwards. Double buffering has to be activated (see enableDoubleBuffering) before calling syncToFrameRate.

    • init

      public static void init(int width, int height)
      Opens a window with a dimension of width x height. The origin is at the upper left corner. The y-axis points downwards.
      Parameter:
      width - width of the window in pixels
      height - height of the window in pixels

    • init

      public static void init(int width, int height, String title)
      Opens a window with a dimension of width x height. The origin is at the upper left corner. The y-axis points downwards.
      Parameter:
      width - width of the window in pixels
      height - height of the window in pixels
      title - title of the window

    • setFps

      public static void setFps(int fps)

    • setColor

      public static void setColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Sets the active color to the given values. Each parameter may be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      red - the red color channel
      green - the green color channel
      blue - the blue color channel

    • setColor

      public static void setColor(int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Sets the active color to the given values. Each parameter may be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      red - the red color channel
      green - the green color channel
      blue - the blue color channel
      alpha - the alpha channel (used for transparency)

    • setBackgroundColor

      public static void setBackgroundColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Sets the background color to the given values. Each parameter may be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      red - the red color channel
      green - the green color channel
      blue - the blue color channel

    • filledRect

      public static void filledRect(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draws a filled rectangular shape using the active color.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the upper left corner.
      y - y-coordinate of the upper left corner.
      width - width of the rectangle.
      height - height of the rectangle.

    • filledEllipse

      public static void filledEllipse(int x, int y, int width, int height)

    • ellipse

      public static void ellipse(int x, int y, int width, int height)

    • polyLine

      public static void polyLine(int[] xCoords, int[] yCoords)

    • polygon

      public static void polygon(int[] xCoords, int[] yCoords)

    • filledPolygon

      public static void filledPolygon(int[] xCoords, int[] yCoords)

    • rect

      public static void rect(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draws a rectangular shape.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the upper left corner.
      y - y-coordinate of the upper left corner.
      width - width of the rectangle.
      height - height of the rectangle.

    • line

      public static void line(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the active color.
      Parameter:
      x1 - x-coordinate of the start of the line.
      y1 - y-coordinate of the start of the line.
      x2 - x-coordinate of the end of the line.
      y2 - y-coordinate of the end of the line.

    • lineFat

      public static void lineFat(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)

    • horizontalLine

      public static void horizontalLine(int x, int y, int width)
      Draws a horizontal line from (x, y) to (x + width - 1, y) using the active color.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the start of the line.
      y - y-coordinate of the start of the line.
      width - width of the line in pixels.

    • text

      public static void text(int x, int y, String text)
      Draws the given text in the default font size. The first character starts at x and the baseline of the text is defined by y.
      Parameter:
      x - position of the first character
      y - baseline of the text
      text - the text which is drawn

    • text

      public static void text(int x, int y, char text)
      Draws the given character in the default font size. The character starts at x and the baseline of the text is defined by y.
      Parameter:
      x - position of the character
      y - baseline of the text
      text - the character which is drawn

    • text

      public static void text(int x, int y, String text, int size)
      Draws the given text in the given font size. The first character starts at x and the baseline of the text is defined by y.
      Parameter:
      x - position of the first character
      y - baseline of the text
      text - the text which is drawn
      size - the size of the font.

    • getTextWidth

      public static int getTextWidth(String text, int size)
      Parameter:
      text - the text for which the width is computed
      size - the size of the font.
      Gibt zurück:
      Returns the width of the given text in pixeln.

    • text

      public static void text(int x, int y, String text, int size, int width)
      Draws the given text in the given font size centered in a box. The box starts at x and is width pixel wide. If width is smaller than 1 the text is drawn at x.

    • setFont

      public static void setFont(String fontfamilyName)
      Limitations: The Draw class only works with fonts in plain style in order to keep the interface simpel.
      Parameter:
      fontfamilyName - The name of the font family. Note, that this can be different from the file name.

    • registerFont

      public static void registerFont(String fileName)
      Loads a font from hard drive and registers it. Java supports TTF and OTF fonts.
      Parameter:
      fileName - The file name of the font

    • setPixel

      public static void setPixel(int x, int y)
      Draws a pixel at (x, y) using the active color.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the pixel.
      y - y-coordinate of the pixel.

    • setPixel

      public static void setPixel(int x, int y, int col)
      Draws a pixel at (x, y) using the given color. This method is more efficient than using the active color since the given color is directly set.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the pixel.
      y - y-coordinate of the pixel.
      col - the color in the format ARGB

    • setPixelUsingAlpha

      public static void setPixelUsingAlpha(int x, int y, int col)

    • setPixelUsingAlpha

      public static void setPixelUsingAlpha(int startX, int startY, int w, int h, int[] rgbArray, int offset, int scanSize)

    • setPixel

      public static void setPixel(int startX, int startY, int w, int h, int[] rgbArray, int offset, int scanSize)

    • getPixelColor

      public static int[] getPixelColor(int x, int y)
      Returns the color of the pixel at the given coordinates. The color is returned as an array containing r, g and b. Each returned value will be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the pixel.
      y - y-coordinate of the pixel.
      Gibt zurück:
      the color as an array containing r, g and b.

    • getPixel

      public static int getPixel(int x, int y)
      Return the color of the pixel at the given coordinates. The color is returned as a single packed integer in the format ARGB.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the pixel.
      y - y-coordinate of the pixel.
      Gibt zurück:
      the color as a single packed integer.

    • enableDoubleBuffering

      public static void enableDoubleBuffering(boolean enabled)
      When enabled the shapes are drawn into the frontBuffer and a call to syncToFrameRate() will swap the buffers. Otherwise all shapes are directly rendered into the frontBuffer and a call to syncToFrameRate() is not necessary.
      Parameter:
      enabled - true enables double buffering, false disables it

    • enableAntiAliasing

      public static void enableAntiAliasing(boolean enabled)

    • enableShowFPS

      public static void enableShowFPS(boolean enabled)

    • hideMouseCursor

      public static void hideMouseCursor(boolean hidden)

    • isKeyDown

      public static boolean isKeyDown(int keyCode)

    • waitForKeyboard

      public static int waitForKeyboard()
      Suspends the program until a key is pressed.
      Gibt zurück:
      An integer code for the key which was pressed. See KeyEvent class or KeyEvent Documentation for a list of key codes.

    • getLastPressedKey

      public static int getLastPressedKey()
      Returns the key code of the key which was pressed last. If this key is released later the value -1 is returned. Note, that previously pressed and not released keys, will not be reported.
      Gibt zurück:
      -1 if no key is pressed or an integer code for the key which was pressed most recently. See KeyEvent class or KeyEvent Documentation for a list of key codes.

    • getLastTypedKeyCode

      public static int getLastTypedKeyCode()

    • getLastTypedKeyChar

      public static char getLastTypedKeyChar()

    • getMouseX

      public static int getMouseX()
      Gibt zurück:
      x-coordinate of the mouse cursor within the drawable area.

    • getMouseY

      public static int getMouseY()
      Gibt zurück:
      y-coordinate of the mouse cursor within the drawable area.

    • isLeftMouseButtonPressed

      public static boolean isLeftMouseButtonPressed()
      Gibt zurück:
      true, if the left mouse button is pressed (i.e. it is down)

    • isRightMouseButtonPressed

      public static boolean isRightMouseButtonPressed()
      Gibt zurück:
      true, if the right mouse button is pressed (i.e. it is down)

    • setButtonWidth

      public static void setButtonWidth(int width)

    • setButtonHeight

      public static void setButtonHeight(int height)

    • button

      public static boolean button(String name, int x, int y)
      Draws a button with default width and height.
      Parameter:
      name - centered label of the button
      x - x-coordinate of upper left corner
      y - y-coordinate of upper left corner
      Gibt zurück:
      true, if the button is pressed

    • slider

      public static int slider(int x, int y, int value)

    • loadImage

      public static int[][] loadImage(String fileName)
      Loads an image from hard drive.
      Parameter:
      fileName - The file name of the image
      Gibt zurück:
      An 2D array containing the pixels of the image. Each pixel has the format ARGB. The array addresses first the rows, then the columns.

    • blendImage

      public static void blendImage(int x, int y, int[][] image, boolean mirror)
      Draws the given image into the front buffer. The alpha values are used to smoothly blend the image over the current content of the front buffer.
      Parameter:
      x - x-coordinate of the upper left corner where the image will be drawn
      y - y-coordinate of the upper left corner where the image will be drawn
      image - the image date as an 2D array (first rows, then columns) containing the pixel data
      mirror - indicates if the image will be mirrored on the x-axis

    • saveScreenshot

      public static void saveScreenshot(String fileName)
      Saves the content of the front buffer to a PNG file.
      Parameter:
      fileName - the name of the file

    • loadSound

      public static Clip loadSound(String fileName)
      Loads an audio clip from the harddrive. Java supported several formats. Tested only WAV yet.
      Parameter:
      fileName - Path and filenname of the file.
      Gibt zurück:
      A clip which allows to play the sound later.

    • playSound

      public static void playSound(Clip clip)
      Plays the given audio clip.
      Parameter:
      clip - The clip to play.

    • hsvToRgb

      public static int[] hsvToRgb(float hue, float saturation, float v)

    • intToRgb

      public static int[] intToRgb(int color)
      Unpacks the parameter color in the format ARGB into an array of integers containing r, g, b. Each returned value will be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      color - the color to be unpacked
      Gibt zurück:
      An array containing R, G and B

    • rgbToInt

      public static int rgbToInt(int r, int g, int b)
      Packs the parameters r, g, b into a single integer in the format ARGB. Each parameter may be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      r - red color channel
      g - green color channel
      b - blue color channel
      Gibt zurück:
      the packed integer.

    • intToRgba

      public static int[] intToRgba(int color)
      Unpacks the parameter color in the format ARGB into an array of integers containing r, g, b, a. Each returned value will be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      color - the color to be unpacked
      Gibt zurück:
      An array containing R, G and B

    • rgbaToInt

      public static int rgbaToInt(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Packs the parameters r, g, b, a into a single integer in the format ARGB. Each parameter may be in the range [0,255].
      Parameter:
      r - red color channel
      g - green color channel
      b - blue color channel
      a - alpha channel (used for transparency)
      Gibt zurück:
      the packed integer.

    • getNextRandom

      public static double getNextRandom()

    • setRandomSeed

      public static void setRandomSeed(long seed)
      Set the seed value for the random number generator.
